channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Kerb Stone, 10th September
item.description:
There is a chunk of broken kerb stone in the park, last night a child has possibly broken a finger as another child picked up the stone and dropped it. These are 5 year olds and the park mis busy after school the piece of kerb stone needs to be removed as more will be injured, The bit of stone does not appear to be from the park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heron Hill, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of large bits of expanded polystyrene blowing around, 10th September
item.description:
There's a lot of it at the junction of Godwin Road and Homesdale Road. It's gradually going to get run over by cars and crushed into smaller bits.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Godwin Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken fence, 10th September
item.description:
This fence was first damaged and then completely broken in the last week or so. It is a safety hazard as it is simply on the pavement so elderly or mobility impaired people not concentrate in the evening etc.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): College Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees and Kiosk light, 10th September
item.description:
The security light at the kiosk where the splash park is is constantly flickering all day and at night it shines into residents windows and this is constantly flickering all night. Also the resident said that the trees that are backing onto her property are overhanging her property. she has reported the trees before but nothing has been done and they need attention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A206, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 wooden pallets have been deposited on the footpath beside 18 Kingfisher Close, 10th September
item.description:
3 wooden pallets have been deposited on the footpath beside 18 Kingfisher Close. They are currently on edge, if pulled over thy could fall on someone and/or block the footpath. Please could you arrange for them to be removed. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingfisher Close, London

item.title: Two dead foxes, one on either side of creek road. One on the road itself., 10th September
item.description:
Please could you collect two dead foxes on Creek Road? One is on the same side as the street as Rose Pharmacy, near Dancers Way, on the road so causing traffic obstruction. The other one is on the same side of the street as the cycle shop, on the pedestrian crossing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Harmony Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree dead, 10th September
item.description:
This tree appears to have died. I reported it as unhappy last year and it lost all its leaves in May this year. I believe it’s a cypress. Previous report: https://fix.bromley.gov.uk/report/6120847

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Otford Close, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homesdale road is littered with polystyrene, 10th September
item.description:
129 Homesdale road is an unathorised HMO where rubbish is not handled properly. They do not recycle anything and all bins are filled with black bags of undifferentiated rubbish. The bin men have not collected their bags today and with the wind one has ended on the road and now there is polystyrene everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homesdale Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin overflowing (again), 10th September
item.description:
The public bin next to Beadon Road bus stop is overflowing yet again. This is a public health hazard and is likely to further exacerbate the existing local fox problem. Please empty as a matter of urgency and increase the frequency of emptying in the future.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Cameron Road, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
